sentence.Network_en: At his bidding, the delegates rose and sang the national anthem.
sentence.Network_cn: 按照他的要求，代表们起立唱国歌。

sentence.Network_en: During the playing of the national anthem the crowd roared and whistled.
sentence.Network_cn: 在播放国歌的时候，人们喊叫着，吹着口哨。

sentence.Network_en: And then the orchestra struck up the National Anthem.
sentence.Network_cn: 然后管弦乐队奏起了国歌。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  antefn, antifne (denoting a composition sung antiphonally), from late Latin antiphona (see antiphon)The spelling with th, which began in the 16th cent., was on the pattern of similar words such as Antony, Anthony

entry.tran: 国歌；（代表某一社会或团体的）颂歌，赞歌
entry.def: An anthem is a song which is used to represent a particular nation, society, or group and which is sung on special occasions.

example.ex: The band played the Czech anthem.

means.word_mean: 1. a song of devotion or loyalty (as to a nation or school)
2. a song of praise (to God or to a saint or to a nation)

sentences.en: They usually play the national anthems of the teams at the beginning of a big match.
sentences.cn: 在大型赛事开始前, 他们通常演奏参赛国国歌。
